Sarah Ward I feel sorry for you dear, you are lost in stress hormones, and missing the point entirely, esp with a hormone like cortisol, which is elevated in ATHLETES and those who are more ACTIVE, such as a NATURAL animal in its NATURAL environment, the open sea...swimming THOUSANDS of more miles per month, than an ENSLAVED being, being kept in a TINY tank, with barely enough room to swim enough to release an endorphine, let alone a hormone that is NORMALLY elevated by a NATURAL LIFE, in a NATURAL ENVIRONMENT....ya know genius, my stress hormones would go down if I was kept in a tiny tank and had nothing to worry about and nowhere to go, however, I would not call what I was doing LIVING....again, you are attempting to defend the indefensible, warping the use of biochemistry to fit your PORPOISES....when you are ready to have lower cortisol levels via the extreme adrenal exhaustion put upon you from being held a captive prisoner and tortured every day, let me know....I know some guys in the plexiglass business
